title: Ticket #7325: Error when Python bindings fail to create a new procid needs context
description:
When the Python bindings are submitting jobs and fail to get a new procid, the error is technically correct but useless to the user: 

RuntimeError: Failed to create new proc ID.

The relevant source code looks like https://github.com/htcondor/htcondor/blob/45431756fd2a202c3ac7f7698181a007a1a43aee/src/python-bindings/schedd.cpp#L2849

TJ indicates that it should be possible to also extract the actual errno at this point, instead of just checking whether procid < 0. 

EACCES if OwnerCheck fails, or clusterid is not current
EINVAL if one of the max jobs limits is triggered.
ETIMEDOUT if there was a problem with the socket or a protocol error

This extra information should be communicated in the exception message, and if #6935 ever happens, with a custom exception type.
